story:
Once upon a time in the magical land of Tajikistan, there lived a young girl named Leila. Leila had a special gift - she could speak to animals. Each night, before she went to bed, Leila would sneak out to the fields to chat with her animal friends under the silvery moonlight.

On one starry night, Leila heard a soft thud coming from the bushes nearby. Curious, she tiptoed over to investigate and found a tiny bird with a broken wing. The little bird was named Sohrab, and he had flown too close to a storm cloud.

With gentle hands, Leila cradled Sohrab in her palms and promised to help him mend his wing. She brought him inside her cozy home and fashioned a tiny splint for his wing, all the while whispering soothing words to comfort him.

As days passed, Leila and Sohrab became the best of friends. Sohrab would sing the most beautiful melodies, filling their home with joy. And in return, Leila would tell him stories of her adventures with her animal friends in the magical land of Tajikistan.

One night, as they gazed up at the twinkling stars, Sohrab asked Leila, "Do you think I'll ever fly again?" Leila smiled warmly and replied, "With patience and determination, anything is possible, my dear friend."

And so, as the months went by, Sohrab's wing healed, and he fluttered around the room in pure delight. Leila watched with tears of happiness in her eyes, knowing that she had helped this little bird soar once more.

From that day on, Sohrab became Leila's faithful companion, accompanying her on her nightly adventures with the animals of Tajikistan. Together, they roamed the forests and mountains, spreading kindness and joy wherever they went.

And so, dear child, remember that even in the darkness of night, there is always light to guide us on our journey. May your dreams be filled with the magic of friendship and the power of love. Goodnight, sweet child. And sleep well under the watchful eyes of the stars above.
